perturbation.original_text: Term. This Second Amendment shall be effective from The Second Amendment Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2021. Upon expiration, this Second Amendment shall be of no further force or effect, and the terms and conditions of the Agreement shall as they were before the Second Amendment Effective Date. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, a Party’s right to enforce the terms and conditions of this Second Amendment shall survive the Second Amendment’s expiration.
perturbation.changed_text: Term. This Second Amendment shall be effective from The Second Amendment Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2021. Upon expiration, this Second Amendment shall be of no further force or effect. A Party’s right to enforce the terms and conditions of this Second Amendment shall terminate upon the Second Amendment’s expiration, notwithstanding any statement to the contrary within this agreement or any prior agreements.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that the right to enforce the terms would survive the expiration of the agreement. The modified text explicitly states that the right to enforce terminates upon expiration, creating a direct contradiction about the enforceability of the agreement post-expiration.

perturbation.original_text: During the Term, Premier shall have the right (but not the obligation) to order from Heritage quantities of Products in excess of [***] and provided Heritage has the capacity and the ability to produce such additional quantities of Products, Heritage agrees to produce such additional quantities per the pricing and terms on Schedule C.
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term, Premier shall have the right (but not the obligation) to order from Heritage quantities of Products in excess of [***]. Heritage may, at its sole discretion, produce such additional quantities based on internal capacity, resource availability, and any other business factors it deems relevant. Pricing and terms for such additional quantities will be subject to negotiation, but in no case exceed the rates in Schedule C.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that Heritage agrees to produce additional quantities per the pricing and terms on Schedule C if Premier orders them and Heritage has the capacity. The modified text states that Heritage may produce additional quantities at its sole discretion and includes an ambiguous price negotiation clause, thus contradicting the previous mandatory production upon request.

perturbation.original_text: Heritage shall purchase all ingredients and packaging materials identified in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing as identified on the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l. Heritage shall not, however, purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those required [***].
perturbation.changed_text: Heritage shall purchase ingredients and packaging materials at their discretion. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing. Premier will reimburse all costs associated with the purchase. Heritage may purchase ingredients or packaging materials exceeding those required [***] and Premier is responsible for all associated charges.
perturbation.explanation: The original text limited ingredient and packaging material purchases to those identified in schedules and those required [***]. The modified text removes these constraints by giving Heritage total discretion in purchasing and explicitly stating that Premier is responsible for all costs, including those exceeding the original requirements.
